title: Apple reportedly producing more iPhones in India: What to know
description: Apple (AAPL) may be accelerating its shift away from Chinese manufacturing, as it reportedly plans to move more iPhone production to India, according to Reuters. Yahoo Finance Technology Editor Dan Howley joins Morning Brief to explain how Apple is positioning India as a key manufacturing hub for US-bound iPhones amid uncertainty over US trade policy. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

title: Cloud AI Today - Automating Cloud Security: A New Era in Threat Management
description: The recent announcement of IONIX's Cloud Exposure Validator highlights a significant advancement in cloud AI security operations. By automating over 80% of CNAPP alert analysis, this AI-driven solution helps security teams by reducing alert fatigue and enabling a focus on genuine, exploitable risks, reclassifying 40% of alerts as non-critical. This tool promises to streamline the manual alert validation process, traditionally a time-consuming task, thereby enhancing operational efficiency and...

title: Verizon, AT&T, and T-Mobile prepare to raise prices on consumers because of Trump's trade war
description: America's biggest phone carriers warn about much higher prices if tariffs on smartphones were to kick in.

title: 2 Top Stocks You Can Buy Now With $500
description: Wall Street's concerns over tariffs and how President Donald Trump's trade wars will impact the U.S. economy have sent the Nasdaq Composite down by around 18% year to date, and it's off more than 20% from its peak.  For less than $500, you can buy one share each of Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) and Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL).  The market sell-off has taken Amazon down to $166 per share at the time of this writing.

title: Apple to shift iPhone production to India
description: As the US's trade war with China persists, the electronics giant is taking rapid steps to secure its supply chain.

title: 5 Things to Know Before the Stock Market Opens
description: News of the day for April 25, 2025

title: Apple iPhones Will Cost More, CEOs Warned. It Has a Plan to Neuter Tariffs.
description: Apple  is squarely in the middle of the U.S.-China trade war but it has a plan to avoid a sharp increase in the cost of iPhones.  The chief executives of both  Verizon Communications  and  AT&T  warned this week that they would pass on any increase in handset prices resulting from tariffs to consumers—a potential blow to Apple, coming on top of a lackluster sales cycle for the iPhone 16 released last year.  The Trump administration has temporarily exempted smartphones, computers, and other items from the current duties of 145% on China imports.

title: Apple plans to shift all US-bound iPhone production from China to India in response to Trump tariffs
description: Tariffs are starting to see major companies react with changes to their supply chains and production locations

title: Apple to move production of US iPhones from China to India over tariffs – report
description: Experts have already warned the price of electronics generally, and not just Apple products, are likely to rise.

title: Apple Plans to Move US-Bound iPhone Assembly to India From China, Report Says
description: Apple reportedly is planning to move the assembly of all iPhones it sells in the U.S. to India, as President Donald Trump's tariffs prompt companies to lower their exposure to China.

title: Why Warren Buffett Isn't Likely to Buy Tesla Stock -- Ever
description: Back on April Fools' Day, there were rumors about Warren Buffett acquiring Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) for $1 trillion and taking it over, in what would have been a stunning move for the billionaire investor.  While Tesla is a leading company in the electric vehicle (EV) market, it's simply not the type of stock I would ever expect Buffett to buy, let alone for it to take up a significant position in the Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.A)(NYSE: BRK.B) portfolio.  Here's why Buffett would likely never own the stock, regardless of its valuation.

title: Meet the Stock Warren Buffett Has Spent More Buying Than Apple, Bank of America, Coca-Cola, American Express, and Chevron, Combined!
description: The Oracle of Omaha has put nearly $78 billion to work in his favorite stock in less than seven years.

title: Are Epic Fights Brewing Over This Lucrative Apple Business?
description: It isn't every day -- or every year, even -- that a high-profile credit card business comes up for grabs.  The tech giant is jettisoning the product's current issuer, a change that also might result in a switch of the network operator facilitating the card's transactions.  A great many Apple Card holders are also Apple device owners, meaning that at first blush, anyway, they comprise a relatively affluent crowd.

title: Elizabeth Warren Slams Tim Cook Over Alleged Backdoor Deal With Trump To Shield Apple From Crushing China Tariffs: 'Creates The Appearance Of Impropriety'
description: On Wednesday, Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass.) requested answers from Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) CEO Tim Cook, citing a pattern of "influence-peddling" between the iPhone-maker and the Donald Trump administration over the trade negotiations with China. What Happened: In a letter to Cook that was obtained by Bloomberg News, Warren questioned Apple CEO's involvement in securing tariff exemptions on Apple products after Trump threatened to impose duties as high as 145% on Chinese imports. title: Elon Musk Equates Car Ownership In Future To Riding A Horse While Using A Flip Phone — Pierre Ferragu Says Tesla's 'iPhone Moment' Hinges On Full Autonomy
description: On Tuesday, during Tesla Inc.'s (NASDAQ:TSLA) first-quarter earnings call, CEO Elon Musk predicted that car ownership will soon become obsolete. What Happened: Musk said that most people will no longer buy cars in the future, framing the shift as an inevitable change.
